issuetype.description: A user story. Created by JIRA Software - do not edit or delete.
issuetype.name: Story

status.description: This issue is undergoing QA.  See linked QA issue(s) for progress.
status.name: In QA

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to be able to perform the following batch operations in SQS:

ChangeMessageVisibilityBatch
DeleteMessageBatch
ReceiveMessage (message size set to > 1)
SendMessageBatch

The underlying actions must be implemented prior to this story.  

Tests include
1) Should be unable to call 'ChangeMessageVisibilityBatch' against a nonexistent account queue url (immediate failue).
2) Should be unable to call 'ChangeMessageVisibilityBatch' against a different account queue url (immediate failue).  
3) Should be unable to call 'ChangeMessageVisibilityBatch' against a nonexistent  queue url (immediate failue). 
4) Should be unable to call 'ChangeMessageVisibilityBatch' with bogus receipt handles (failure within batch results).
5) Should be unable to call 'ChangeMessageVisibilityBatch' with too low visibility timeout (failure within batch results).  
6) Should be unable to call 'ChangeMessageVisibilityBatch' with too low high timeout (failure within batch results).  
7) Should be unable to call 'ChangeMessageVisibilityBatch' on a deleted message (failure within batch results).  
8) Should be unable to call 'ChangeMessageVisibilityBatch' on an old recipt handle (failure within batch results).  
9) Should be unable to call 'ChangeMessageVisibilityBatch' with no batch entries (immediate failure).  
10) Should be unable to call 'ChangeMessageVisibilityBatch' with too many batch entries (immediate failure).  
11) Should be unable to call 'ChangeMessageVisibilityBatch' with duplicate batch ids, or a batch id that is empty, null, too long, or constains invalid characters (immediate failure).
12) Test a successful case with 'ChangeMessageVisibilityBatch' with multiple messages and visibility timeouts.  Also verify messages are not received until after the timeouts.
13) Should be unable to call 'DeleteMessageBatch' against a nonexistent account queue url (immediate failue).
14) Should be unable to call 'DeleteMessageBatch' against a different account queue url (immediate failue).  
15) Should be unable to call 'DeleteMessageBatch' against a nonexistent  queue url (immediate failue). 
16) Should be unable to call 'DeleteMessageBatch' with bogus receipt handles (failure within batch results).
17) Verify that calling 'DeleteMessageBatch' against old receipt handles will not fail, but also not delete messages, and that calling it against current receipt handles will delete the messages.
18) Should be unable to call 'DeleteMessageBatch' with no batch entries (immediate failure).  
19) Should be unable to call 'DeleteMessageBatch' with too many batch entries (immediate failure).  
20) Should be unable to call 'DeleteMessageBatch' with duplicate batch ids, or a batch id that is empty, null, too long, or constains invalid characters (immediate failure).
21) Test a successful case with 'DeleteMessageBatch' with multiple messages.  Also create other messages and verify that they are not deleted.
22) Should be unable to call 'SendMessageBatch' against a nonexistent account queue url (immediate failue).
23) Should be unable to call 'SendMessageBatch' against a different account queue url (immediate failue).  
24) Should be unable to call 'SendMessageBatch' against a nonexistent  queue url (immediate failue). 
25) Should be unable to call 'SendMessageBatch' with too low or high visibility timeout (immediate failure), and that calling with a valid visibility timeout will work.
26) Should be unable to call 'SendMessageBatch' with an attribute name that is invalid (in the same way we test against the SendMessage case) (immediate failure).
27) Should be unable to call 'SendMessageBatch' with an attribute value that is invalid (in the same way we test against the SendMessage case) (immediate failure).
28) Should be unable to call 'SendMessageBatch' with an body that is invalid (in the same way we test against the SendMessage case) (immediate failure).
29) Should be unable to call 'SendMessageBatch' with a single message that exceeds the maximum message length. (immediate failure).
30) Should be able to call 'SendMessageBatch' successfully with a single message (perhaps with multiple calls).  Verify what is sent is what is received.
31) Should be unable to call 'SendMessageBatch' with no batch entries (immediate failure).  
32) Should be unable to call 'SendMessageBatch' with too many batch entries (immediate failure).  
33) Should be unable to call 'SendMessageBatch' with multipe messages whose total length exceeds the maximum message length. (immediate failure).
34) Should be unable to call 'SendMessageBatch' with duplicate batch ids, or a batch id that is empty, null, too long, or constains invalid characters (immediate failure).
35) Should be able to call 'SendMessageBatch' successfully with a multiple messages.  Verify what is sent is what is received.
36) Test 'ReceiveMessage' with various values for MaxNumberOfMessages.  Make sure no more than that number of messages are returned.

comments.body:
Unit tests can be found here:
https://github.com/eethomas/n4j/blob/master/src/main/java/com/eucalyptus/tests/awssdk/TestSQSChangeMessageVisibilityBatch.java
https://github.com/eethomas/n4j/blob/master/src/main/java/com/eucalyptus/tests/awssdk/TestSQSDeleteMessageBatch.java
https://github.com/eethomas/n4j/blob/master/src/main/java/com/eucalyptus/tests/awssdk/TestSQSSendMessageBatch.java

and 'testReceiveMaxNumberOfMessages()' in 
https://github.com/eethomas/n4j/blob/master/src/main/java/com/eucalyptus/tests/awssdk/TestSQSReceiveMessage.java
